get.summary: Get all subgroups of a customergroup.
get.description:
Returns all customer groups that are direct subgroups of a customergroup.

To try out the methods of the Customer Groups controller, you must authorize a user who belongs to the “customermanagergroup”.

parameters.name: currentPage
parameters.description: Current page number (starts with 0).

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of customer group returned in one page.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Response configuration. This is the list of fields that should be returned in the response body.

parameters.name: baseSiteId
parameters.description: Base site identifier

post.description:
Creates a new customer group that is a direct subgroup of a customergroup.

To try out the methods of the Customer Groups controller, you must authorize a user who belongs to the “customermanagergroup”.

parameters.name: userGroup
parameters.description: User group object with id and name.

parameters.name: baseSiteId
parameters.description: Base site identifier

get.summary: Get a specific customer group.
get.description:
Returns a customer group with a specific groupId.

To try out the methods of the Customer Groups controller, you must authorize a user who belongs to the “customermanagergroup”.

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: Group identifier.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Response configuration. This is the list of fields that should be returned in the response body.

parameters.name: baseSiteId
parameters.description: Base site identifier

put.summary: Sets members for a user group.
put.description:
Sets members for a user group. The list of existing members is overwritten with a new one.

To try out the methods of the Customer Groups controller, you must authorize a user who belongs to the “customermanagergroup”.

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: Group identifier.

parameters.name: members
parameters.description: List of users to set for customer group.

parameters.name: baseSiteId
parameters.description: Base site identifier

patch.summary: Assigns user(s) to a customer group.
patch.description:
Assigns user(s) to a customer group.

To try out the methods of the Customer Groups controller, you must authorize a user who belongs to the “customermanagergroup”.

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: Group identifier.

parameters.name: members
parameters.description: List of users to assign to customer group.

parameters.name: baseSiteId
parameters.description: Base site identifier

delete.summary: Delete a user from a customer group.
delete.description:
Removes user from a customer group.

To try out the methods of the Customer Groups controller, you must authorize a user who belongs to the “customermanagergroup”.

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: Group identifier.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: User identifier.

parameters.name: baseSiteId

get.summary: Get a list of supported countries.
get.description: Lists all supported delivery countries for the current store. The list is sorted alphabetically.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Response configuration. This is the list of fields that should be returned in the response body.

parameters.name: baseSiteId
parameters.description: Base site identifier

get.summary: Get a list of product exports.
get.description: Used for product export. Depending on the timestamp parameter, it can return all products or only products modified after the given time.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Response configuration. This is the list of fields that should be returned in the response body.

parameters.name: currentPage
parameters.description: The current result page requested.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of results returned per page.

parameters.name: catalog
parameters.description: The catalog to retrieve products from. The catalog must be provided along with the version.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The catalog version. The catalog version must be provided along with the catalog.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: When this parameter is set, only products modified after the given time will be returned. This parameter should be in ISO-8601 format (for example, 2018-01-09T16:28:45+0000).

parameters.name: baseSiteId
parameters.description: Base site identifier

get.summary: Get a list of orders with status updates
get.description: Returns the orders that have changed status. Returns only the elements from the current baseSite that have been updated after the provided timestamp.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: Only items newer than the given parameter are retrieved. This parameter should be in ISO-8601 format (for example, 2018-01-09T16:28:45+0000).

parameters.name: baseSiteId
parameters.description: Base site identifier

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Response configuration. This is the list of fields that should be returned in the response body.

post.summary: Generates a token to restore a customer's forgotten password.
post.description: Generates a token to restore a customer's forgotten password.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Customer's user id. Customer user id is case insensitive.

parameters.name: baseSiteId
parameters.description: Base site identifier

post.summary: Verify the decision of the Merchant
post.description:
Verifies the decision of the merchant. 

Note, the “Try it out” button is not enabled for this method (always returns an error) because the Merchant Callback Controller handles parameters differently, depending on which payment provider is used. For more information about this controller, please refer to the “acceleratorwebservicesaddon AddOn” documentation on help.hybris.com.

parameters.name: baseSiteId
parameters.description: Base site identifier

post.summary: Verify the decision of the Merchant for a cart
post.description:
Verifies the decision of the merchant for a specified cart, and stores information of the PaymentSubscriptionResult for the cart. 

Note, the “Try it out” button is not enabled for this method (always returns an error) because the Merchant Callback Controller handles parameters differently, depending on which payment provider is used. For more information about this controller, please refer to the “acceleratorwebservicesaddon AddOn” documentation on help.hybris.com.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: User identifier or one of the literals : 'current' for currently authenticated user, 'anonymous' for anonymous user

parameters.name: cartId
parameters.description: Cart identifier: cart code for logged in user, cart guid for anonymous user, 'current' for the last modified cart

parameters.name: baseSiteId
parameters.description: Base site identifier

get.summary: Get a list of available languages.
get.description: Lists all available languages (all languages used for a particular store). If the list of languages for a base store is empty, a list of all languages available in the system will be returned.

parameters.description: Response configuration. This is the list of fields that should be returned in the response body.

parameters.description: Base site identifier

get.summary: Get products added to the express update feed
get.description: Returns products added to the express update feed. Returns only elements updated after the provided timestamp. The queue is cleared using a defined cronjob.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: Only items newer than the given parameter are retrieved from the queue. This parameter should be in ISO-8601 format.

parameters.name: catalog
parameters.description: Only products from this catalog are returned. Format: catalogId:catalogVersion

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Response configuration. This is the list of fields that should be returned in the response body.

parameters.name: baseSiteId
parameters.description: Base site identifier

get.summary: Get a list of products and additional data
get.description: Returns a list of products and additional data, such as available facets, available sorting, and pagination options. It can also include spelling suggestions. To make spelling suggestions work, you need to make sure that "enableSpellCheck" on the SearchQuery is set to "true" (by default, it should already be set to "true"). You also need to have indexed properties configured to be used for spellchecking.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Serialized query, free text search, facets. The format of a serialized query: freeTextSearch:sort:facetKey1:facetValue1:facetKey2:facetValue2

parameters.name: currentPage
parameters.description: The current result page requested.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of results returned per page.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Response configuration. This is the list of fields that should be returned in the response body.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: The context to be used in the search query.

parameters.name: searchQueryContext
parameters.description: searchQueryContext

parameters.name: baseSiteId
parameters.description: Base site identifier

get.summary: Get a product's stock level
get.description: Returns a product's stock levels sorted by distance from the specified location, which is provided using the free-text "location" parameter, or by using the longitude and latitude parameters. The following two sets of parameters are available: location (required), currentPage (optional), pageSize (optional); or longitude (required), latitude (required), currentPage (optional), pageSize(optional).

parameters.name: productCode
parameters.description: Product identifier

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Free-text location

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description: Latitude location parameter.

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description: Longitude location parameter.

parameters.name: currentPage
parameters.description: The current result page requested.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of results returned per page.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Response configuration. This is the list of fields that should be returned in the response body.

parameters.name: baseSiteId
parameters.description: Base site identifier

head.summary: Get header with a total number of product's stock levels
head.description: In the response header, the "x-total-count" indicates the total number of a product's stock levels. The following two sets of parameters are available: location (required); or longitude (required), and latitude (required).

parameters.name: productCode
parameters.description: Product identifier

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Free-text location

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description: Latitude location parameter.

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description: Longitude location parameter.

parameters.name: baseSiteId

get.summary: Get a list of promotions
get.description: Returns promotions defined for a current base site. Requests pertaining to promotions have been developed for the previous version of promotions and vouchers and therefore some of them are currently not compatible with the new promotion engine.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Defines what type of promotions should be returned. Values supported for that parameter are:
  • all: All available promotions are returned
  • product: Only product promotions are returned
  • order: Only order promotions are returned

parameters.name: promotionGroup
parameters.description: Only promotions from this group are returned

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Response configuration. This is the list of fields that should be returned in the response body.

parameters.name: baseSiteId
parameters.description: Base site identifier

parameters.description: Promotion identifier (code)

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Response configuration. This is the list of fields that should be returned in the response body.

parameters.name: baseSiteId
parameters.description: Base site identifier

get.summary: Get a list of store locations
get.description: Lists all store locations that are near the location specified in a query or based on latitude and longitude.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Location in natural language i.e. city or country.

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description: Coordinate that specifies the north-south position of a point on the Earth's surface.

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description: Coordinate that specifies the east-west position of a point on the Earth's surface.

parameters.name: currentPage
parameters.description: The current result page requested.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of results returned per page.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sorting method applied to the return results.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: Radius in meters. Max value: 40075000.0 (Earth's perimeter).

parameters.name: accuracy
parameters.description: Accuracy in meters.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Response configuration. This is the list of fields that should be returned in the response body.

parameters.name: baseSiteId
parameters.description: Base site identifier

parameters.description: Response configuration. This is the list of fields that should be returned in the response body.

parameters.name: savedCartsOnly
parameters.description: Optional parameter. If the parameter is provided and its value is true, only saved carts are returned.

parameters.name: currentPage
parameters.description: Optional pagination parameter in case of savedCartsOnly == true. Default value 0.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Optional {@link PaginationData} parameter in case of savedCartsOnly == true. Default value 20.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Optional sort criterion in case of savedCartsOnly == true. No default value.

parameters.description: Base site identifier

parameters.description: User identifier or one of the literals : 'current' for currently authenticated user, 'anonymous' for anonymous user

post.summary: Creates a delivery address for the cart.
post.description: Creates an address and assigns it to the cart as the delivery address.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description:
Request body parameter that contains details such as the customer's first name (firstName), the customer's last name (lastName), the customer's title (titleCode), the country (country.isocode), the first part of the address (line1), the second part of the address (line2), the town (town), the postal code (postalCode), and the region (region.isocode).

The DTO is in XML or .json format.

parameters.description: Response configuration. This is the list of fields that should be returned in the response body.

get.summary: Get consolidated pickup options
get.description:
Returns a list of stores that have all the pick-up items in stock.

Note, if there are no stores that have all the pick up items in stock, or all items are already set to the same pick up location, the response returns an empty list.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Response configuration. This is the list of fields that should be returned in the response body.

parameters.name: baseSiteId
parameters.description: Base site identifier

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: User identifier or one of the literals : 'current' for currently authenticated user, 'anonymous' for anonymous user

parameters.name: cartId
parameters.description: Cart identifier: cart code for logged in user, cart guid for anonymous user, 'current' for the last modified cart

post.description:
Specifies one store location where all items will be picked up.

Note, if any of the items are not available at the specified location, these items are removed from the cart.

parameters.name: storeName
parameters.description: The name of the store where items will be picked up

get.summary: Get information needed for create subscription
get.description: Returns the necessary information for creating a subscription that contacts the payment provider directly. This information contains the payment provider URL and a list of parameters that are needed to create the subscription.

parameters.name: responseUrl
parameters.description: The URL that the payment provider uses to return payment information. Possible values for responseUrl include the following: “orderPage_cancelResponseURL”, “orderPage_declineResponseURL”, and “orderPage_receiptResponseURL”.

parameters.name: extendedMerchantCallback
parameters.description: Define which url should be returned

parameters.name: baseSiteId
parameters.description: Base site identifier

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: User identifier or one of the literals : 'current' for currently authenticated user, 'anonymous' for anonymous user

parameters.name: cartId
parameters.description: Cart identifier: cart code for logged in user, cart guid for anonymous user, 'current' for the last modified cart

get.summary: Get information about create subscription request results
get.description:
Returns information related to creating subscription request results. If there is no response from the payment provider, a "202 Accepted" status is returned. If the subscription is created successfully, the payment details are returned. Otherwise, an error response is returned.

Note, the “Try it out” button is not enabled for this method (always returns an error) because the Extended Carts Controller handles parameters differently, depending on which payment provider is used. For more information about this controller, please refer to the “acceleratorwebservicesaddon AddOn” documentation on help.hybris.com.

post.summary: Defines and assigns details of a new credit card payment to the cart.
post.description: Defines the details of a new credit card, and assigns this payment option to the cart.

parameters.name: paymentDetails
parameters.description:
Request body parameter that contains details such as the name on the card (accountHolderName), the card number (cardNumber), the card type (cardType.code), the month of the expiry date (expiryMonth), the year of the expiry date (expiryYear), whether the payment details should be saved (saved), whether the payment details should be set as default (defaultPaymentInfo), and the billing address (billingAddress.firstName, billingAddress.lastName, billingAddress.titleCode, billingAddress.country.isocode, billingAddress.line1, billingAddress.line2, billingAddress.town, billingAddress.postalCode, billingAddress.region.isocode)

The DTO is in XML or .json format.
